intro: Podolepis rhytidochlamys, commonly known as the rough-leaved podolepis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. Its growth habit is low and spreading, often forming dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. Podolepis rhytidochlamys is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
